sentences.text: The '''2025 World Games''' ({{lang-zh||s=2025年世界运动会|labels=no}}), commonly known as '''Chengdu 2025''', is the 12th edition of the World Games, which includes sports and sporting disciplines that are not contested in the Olympic Games. It is expected to be held from 7 to 17 August 2025 in Chengdu, Sichuan, China. This is the first edition to be held under the guidelines set by the strategy paper "Growth Beyond Excellence", the third edition to be held in Asia, and the first time for the nation to host the World Games.

references.text: <ref>{{cite news |last1=Mackay |first1=Duncan |title=World Games 2025 in Chengdu set to return to normal place on calendar |url=https://www.insidethegames.biz/articles/1114043/chengdu-2025-world-games-dates-calendar |access-date=18 July 2022 |work=Inside the games |date=10 October 2021}}</ref>

sentences.text: Luo Qiang, Mayor of Chengdu, signed the Organiser Agreement for TWG 2025, with the Vice President of IOC and the Chinese Olympic Committee as witness. President José Perurena signed on behalf of the International World Games Association (IWGA).

references.text: <ref name="host">{{cite web |title=The World Games 2025, Chengdu (CHN) |url=https://www.theworldgames.org/editions/Chengdu-CHN-2025-14 |website=World Games |access-date=18 July 2022}}</ref>

sentences.text: On 21 May 2024, the International World Games Association announced venues for the 2025 World Games. Some of the venues selected were also used during the 2021 Summer World University Games, also held in Chengdu.

references.text: <ref name="calendar&venues">{{cite web|url=https://www.theworldgames.org/news/The-World-Games-2025-33/RoadToChengdu2025-Venues-and-competition-days-finalised-2534|title=Venues and the competition days finalised|publisher=The World Games|date=21 May 2024|access-date=30 July 2024}}</ref>

sentences.text: For the first time in World Games history, a torch relay will be held. The torch was revealed on 27 February 2025. Named Zhumeng, and designed by Feng Benyuan (who was one of the designers for the Bing Dwen Dwen and Shuey Rhon Rhon|mascot of the 2022 Winter Paralympics) and Wang Anxu of the Jilin University of Arts, its design blends artistic forms, symbolic colors and cultural motifs in a style that reflects the spirit of the World Games and the heritage of the host nation.

references.text: <ref name="torch">{{cite web|title=TWG 2025 Chengdu Torch Unveiled|url=https://www.theworldgames2025.com/en/activity/news/newsDetail?id=19459&lang=en&cid=focus&locale=en|website=The Organising Committee of The World Games 2025 Chengdu|date=27 February 2025}}</ref>

sentences.text: 34 sports, comprising 60 disciplines and 253 medal events, have been chosen for the 2025 World Games. For the first time, powerboating and cheerleading will be represented at The World Games. In the sector of para sports, para freediving and para ju-jitsu will make their debut. Three sports which have been in all previous editions of The World Games are dropped from the 2025 program: bowling, water-skiing, and artistic roller skating. Esports will also be showcased as part of a partnership between the IWGA and the Global Esports Federation. Sumo, which originally debut at the World Games in 2001, was dropped due to issues during competition at the Sumo at the 2022 World Games|2022 World Games.

sentences.text: The emblem for the games was revealed on May 17, 2024, designed by renowned British designer, John Fairley. The design was inspired by the giant panda, hibiscus flower and Chinese knot.

sentences.text: The mascots for the games were revealed on August 6, 2024. Shubao, a giant panda and Jinzai, a golden snub-nosed monkey, were created to raise awareness about Biodiversity|rare animals and Wildlife conservation|biodiversity protection.
